name: Regulatory Impairment Status (305b/303d/TMDL)
functionStatement: Physical and chemical processes limit pollutants, retain beneficial constituents, and protect ecological and human uses.
descriptionMarkdown:
Regulatory assessment status for aquatic life/designated use support (e.g., 305(b)/303(d) categories, TMDL status) for the assessment unit containing the project reach.
Screening metric used to evaluate Water & soil quality based on the definition and bin thresholds provided for this metric.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel

Method: Desktop (listings/monitoring) and/or Field screening
howToMeasureMarkdown:
Identify the assessment unit for the project reach and consult the state integrated report and/or EPA ATTAINS database for use-support and impairment listings. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.
Use available GIS layers/imagery and/or a field screening (as applicable) to quantify or rate the metric according to the provided bin thresholds.

inputs.label: Regulatory Impairment Status (305b/303d/TMDL)
inputs.helpMarkdown:
ADEC database
EPA ATTAINS; state integrated report tables/GIS; optional local water quality monitoring summaries.
State/agency datasets, GIS/imagery, and field observations (as applicable).

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: In category 1, 2, or 3 or aquatic life uses not evaluated. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: In Category 4 due to nonsupport of aquatic life uses and aquatic life impairment actively being mitigated. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: In Category 4 due to nonsupport of aquatic life uses and aquatic life impairment actively being mitigated. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: In Category 5 due to nonsupport of aquatic life uses OR in Category 4 and aquatic life impairment not actively being mitigated. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)
